page.title: 14MEDIA IN LYTHE
page.content: {MEDIA:-} over 90% of the villagers possess a television set and a radio,30% own a cassette player and 14% own a video recorder.The TV programmes available are BBC 1, BBC 2 from Pontop Pike and ITV 1,ITV 2 from Bilsdale. All the broadcasts are relayed via a booster station on the cliff top at Whiby. Newspapers are collected daily from the village shop by most of the householders. Books are borrowed by many villagers from the mobile Public Library which visits the village every Wednesday for half an hour.Many other villagers regularly buy magazines, mostly from the village shop.
